pros: They understand our needs as students and also offer help and opportunities to learn! Has becoming more and more professional every semester
cons: I do not have anything bad to say they have been improving

pros: opportunity to serve on committees students are hard working perfect institution for mediocre educators who want to do the bare minimum to get by
cons: terrible work life balance you will work more than expected you are not rewarded for doing more you do not matter

review_title: Good benefits if you take advantage of them
pros: Great tuition benefits, work is not too demanding most of the time
cons: Nobody enjoys cleaning a toilet for any reason.

pros: Active engagement with students for learning.
cons: Lower than average faculty compensation

pros: Great students. Supportive faculty. Good opportunity as an additional job. Strong sense of identity and support for Doane.
cons: Feeling disconnected as an adjunct.

pros: Great environment, great benefits, very supportive management
cons: Pay could have been better, we were short staffed a lot in my department but yet other departments were excessively over staffed.

pros: New President has brought some positive energy back to campus. Great community of supportive people. The institution is positioned well financially with a strong endowment, and is planning lots of physical plant improvements.
cons: Many faculty members are experiencing overloads and burnout.

review_title: Your co-workers can fel like family
pros: Create close relationships with co-workers who also genuinely care about students. Have plenty of room to learn new skills. Most supervisors are flexible.
cons: Feel distanced to other campuses. Higher ups often don't know what goes on at the lower levels. Constant staff changes due to people leaving. Medical benefits are not great. You may be asked to wear many hats often.

pros: Good education benefits, good middle management
cons: Going through some things, new President seems good t

pros: working with students to help them succeed in college.
cons:
The school has major financial issues and declining enrollment
Bad management who bullies and takes advantage of the employees under them.
A two tiered system where higher administrators do what they want/when they want while the regular staff must make up the slack
No oversight of department heads 
Bullying and harassment by administrators are tolerated by HR and the higher level admins
Low pay with no opportunities for promotion or salary increases

job_title: Student Library Assistant in Crete, NE
pros: great place to work for students
cons: Pay could be better for students

pros: Great people to work with and plenty of work to keep busy.
cons: Pay is monthly and not weekly or biweekly.

pros: Strong focus on liberal arts education. Crete campus students are very involved. The other campuses have more non-traditional students with strong life experiences. Many are parents who are working, many bring a global perspective from military or other international experiences.
cons: Adjunct instructors have less involvement with the university as a whole and changes going on.

pros: Best thing in the world
cons: Nothing is wrong here ever

pros: People are very nice and friendly.
cons: Expectations are higher for less amount of pay, not as good of benefits of other institutions.

job_title: Experiential Learning Coordinator in Crete, NE
pros: Great with work/life balance. Everyone is understanding and supportive. I also love that we are a smaller institution and I truly get to know the students I work with.
cons: None, that I am aware of so far!

Supportive environment

review_title: Peer Tutor- met with students one on one for tutoring.
pros: The advisor is wonderful and you get to set your own hours.
cons: Sadly the pay is only minimum wage for peer tutors.

pros: Invigorating work with all spectrum of non-traditional students. The work was meaningful and fulfilling
cons: Lack of boundaries and measurements. To sloppy when it came to actuall assessment
